intro: Geniostemon atarjanus, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in shrubland and woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside its native range.
